newsitem.title: USA: COMEX copper called to open unchanged.
newsitem.headline: COMEX copper called to open unchanged.

text.p: COMEX copper futures were called to open unchanged Thursday from Wednesday's close of 105.20 cents a lb, following thin range-bound trading overnight in London.
COMEX September traded in a range between 105.00 and 105.50 cents a lb in overnight ACCESS trade.
LME warehouse copper stocks rose 1,950 tonnes in Thursday's report to 256,300 tonnes, continuing an upward trend that's been in place since June 19, when stocks were 121,550 tonnes.
COMEX copper stocks increased 1,503 short tons Wednseday to 36,063 short tons.
The LME cash-to-three month backwardation narrowed to $12/$13 a tonne, a new 10-month low.
Prices appear to be moving sideways in a range between 103.60 and 112.50 cents with little inclination to break out one way or the other.
Analysts and traders said the market is vulnerable to fund switches of long positions into December and perhaps liquidation this week and next.
